alert.note: Alert for Leelanau (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 06 at 2:35PM EDT until September 06 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR LEELANAU COUNTY... At 235 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. A station near Suttons Bay has measured 4.03 inches of rain today. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Leland, Grand Traverse Light, Suttons Bay, Northport, Lake Leelanau, Peshawbestown, Omena, Leelanau State Park and Good Harbor. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2 INCHES IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
